title: Ticket #7270: when_to_transfer_output = ON_SUCCESS
description:
Duncan M writes:

I am seeing many jobs being held when the process fails because the output file I passed to transfer_output_files doesn't exit. Presuming it is standard practice to have a job that only creates the output file on success, is there a way to tell condor only to expect the output files to exist for passing jobs, something like 

when_to_transfer_output = ON_SUCCESS

? Then just have DAGMan tell me, as normal, that my jobs are failing?
remarks:
2019-Sep-18 13:50:54 by pfc:
This is related to #7269.

2019-Sep-18 15:13:55 by tlmiller:
So if I understand this ticket correctly, the request is that if when_to_transfer_output is ON_SUCCESS, and:

  • the job exits with success_exit_code, behave as the code currently does (HTCondor will expect the files in transfer_output_files to exist).
  • Otherwise, the job should not go on hold, and ... you didn't say what you want to happen to the files?

Options include: (a) not transferring any files back (b) transferring the output files that exist (a missing file isn't doesn't put the job on hold, but other file transfer failures still would), or (c) specifying the list of files to transfer back on failure.

If (c) is at all interesting, would you prefer to have ON_SUCCESS change the semantics of transfer_output_files, or just to directly specify success_output_files and failure_output_files?

2019-Sep-18 16:17:41 by tlmiller:
For the record -- 

Duncan M writes
I would be happy with (a): when_to_transfer_files = ON_SUCCESS
should mean that if my job isn't successful, I don't get anything back. If I
want intermediate files, I can use condor_chirp to get them myself.
